newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo's C70 luxury car delayed - paper.
newsitem.headline: Volvo's C70 luxury car delayed - paper.

text.p: Swedish automotive group Volvo will not be able to meet its target of making between 7,000 and 8,000 of its luxury car model C70, Swedish daily Svenska Dagbladet reported on Tuesday.

Originally Volvo had planned to start customer production of C70s at the beginning of April but because of quality problems it has postponed the start to after the summer holidays, the newspaper said.
Thereby Volvo Cars will produce 3,500 fewer C70s than the planned 7,000-8,000 this year, Svenska Dagbladet said.
"We put quality before volume," Volvo Cars spokesman Ingmar Hesslefors was quoted as saying.
"It would be way too short-sighted of us to release cars that don't meet our high standards."
